sourceMeaningMnemonic: You <radical>stand</radical> at a podium <radical>early</radical> in the morning to practice reading the <kanji>chapter</kanji> from your latest book.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself, standing tall in the light of the early morning. You hold your head up high, open to your bookmark, and read the name of the chapter aloud: "Chapter 42: The Most Important Number."
readingMnemonic: You're practicing this specific <kanji>chapter</kanji> because you've been asked to read it for the <reading>Shou</reading>gun (<ja>しょう</ja>). There will be a bunch of other authors reading chapters of their books to him too, and you want to make a good impression.
readingInfo: Picture yourself in a line with other authors, standing in the early morning, waiting to read chapters from your respective books. You really hope the Shougun likes yours. If he does, you'll be famous! If he doesn't, you might be beheaded.
